thread.title: President Donald Trump responds to ruling by appeals court
thread.title_full: President Donald Trump responds to ruling by appeals court - The Boston Globe

title: President Donald Trump responds to ruling by appeals court
text:
EPA
The White House.
By Christina Prignano Globe staff February 10, 2017
That didn’t take long.
Donald Trump responded mere minutes after an appeals court refused to reinstate his controversial travel ban.
Advertisement
In all caps, he tweeted: “SEE YOU IN COURT, THE SECURITY OF OUR NATION IS AT STAKE!”
SEE YOU IN COURT, THE SECURITY OF OUR NATION IS AT STAKE!
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) February 9, 2017 Washington state Gov. Jay Inslee responded to President Donald Trump’s tweet a short time later, tweeting ‘‘Mr. President, we just saw you in court, and we beat you.’’
Get Political Happy Hour in your inbox: Your afternoon shot of politics, sent straight from the desk of Joshua Miller. Sign Up Thank you for signing up! Sign up for more newsletters here The 9th US Circuit Court of Appeals declined to block a lower-court ruling that suspended the ban and allowed previously barred travelers to enter the US. The ruling was announced around 6 p.m. Eastern time.
View Story Appeals court won’t reinstate travel ban A US appeals court has refused to reinstate Trump’s ban on travelers from seven Muslim-majority nations.
Read the ruling on President Donald Trump’s travel ban
The lower court judge temporarily halted the ban last week after determining that the states were likely to win the case and had shown that the ban would restrict travel by their residents, damage their public universities and reduce their tax base. That ruling prompted Trump to tweet several times about the judge , US District Judge James Robart.
Material from the Associated Press was used in this report. Christina Prignano can be reached at christina.prignano@globe.com . Follow her on Twitter @cprignano .
